Reason: The configuration option 'client_encryption_options' is performance-sensitive. The reason for this classification is that the configuration involves creating SSL contexts, setting up SSL connections, and validating SSL certificates, all of which are time-expensive and memory-expensive operations. These operations directly impact system performance at the system level by adding overhead due to encryption and decryption processes. Additionally, the hot reloading functionality for SSL certificates can lead to notable performance variations by resetting SSL contexts for new connections, further emphasizing the performance sensitivity of this configuration.
